items: Bartonella is the second most common cause of culture-negative endocarditis
Bartonella quintana endocarditis is associated with alcoholism, homelessness and body lice.
Bartonella henselae is associated with cats and valvular disease.
Methods (see J Clin Micro 2021.59: e02217-20 for advantages and limitations of these methods):
Titer of â‰¥ 1:800 good correlation with infective endocarditis
NOTE: low titer cross-reactivity with Coxiella burnetii, Brucella spp, and rarely Enterococcus faecalis
Bartonella-specific RT-PCR of resected heart valve
Due to risk of relapse, treatment of bartonella endocarditis is prolonged. Suggest repeat antibody titers every 6-8 weeks as guide to duration of therapy.

regimenData.notes: Gentamicin target serum levels: peak 3-4 ug/mL and trough <1 ug/mL. Duration of Doxycycline therapy depends on valve resection surgery: If infected valve is resected, continue Doxycycline for another 6 wks. If no valve surgery, continue Doxycycline for another 3 months
If infected valve is surgically resected, continue Azithromycin for another 3 months. If infected valve is not resected, continue Azithromycin for another 6 months

regimenData.condition: If Gentamicin toxicity precludes its use, consultation is suggested

items: Resistance of Bartonella to Doxycyline has not been documented; hence treatment failures likely indicate relapse, not resistance.
TMP-SMX, fluoroquinolones, 1st generation cephalosporins and penicillins are not predictably active against Bartonella quintana and should not be used.
